docs.lead_paragraph: She is 15 and has been smoking since she was in fourth grade. She knows it is a mistake but sees no way out. ''Grown-ups should be trying to stop us, but I can't think of how they could,'' says the high school sophomore, who is willing to talk only if her name is not used.

headline.main: Battle on Youth Smoking Brings Hope and Caution

docs.abstract: Tobacco experts say Woodridge, Ill, Chicago suburb, is best documented case of community that has sharply reduced youth smoking; say its success comes from seven-year-old program based on ordinance that forbids and strictly punishes sale of tobacco products to teen-agers; researchers have praised Woodridge's efforts, and scores of communities have used town as model in drafting their tobacco regulations; Federal Government has cited Woodridge's experience in drafting new regulations on tobacco sales, marketing and distribution; photo (M)
